intro: Solanum nitidum var. hutchisonii, commonly known as the glossy nightshade, is a flowering plant native to parts of Southeast Asia. It is a shrub or small tree that typically grows to a height of 1–3 meters. The plant features dark green, glossy leaves and produces small, yellowish flowers that develop into berries. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates and is often found in disturbed soils or along roadsides. The species is part of the Solanaceae family, which includes other nightshades like tomatoes and potatoes.
